column2: Non-Personally Identifiable Information. When you visit a Website, we may collect certain data that does not tell us specifically who you are. This is Non-Personally Identifiable Information. It includes things like your Internet Protocol (IP) address

Non-Personally Identifiable Information. When you visit a Website, we may collect certain data that does not tell us specifically who you are. This is Non-Personally Identifiable Information. It includes things like your Internet Protocol (IP) address
the last domain you visited before coming to our Website or the domain you go to when you leave
the last domain you visited before coming to our Website or the domain you go to when you leave

We may place a cookie on your computer. A cookie is a small amount of data, which often includes an anonymous unique identifier, sent to your browser from a websites computers and stored on your computers hard drive. We may use cookies to keep track of your choice of language and home page preference; to understand your exposure to certain Internet advertisements as you use the Websites, and to gather usage data that will help us generally improve the quality of the Websites. There is a simple procedure in most browsers that allows you to deny or accept cookies

We may place a cookie on your computer. A cookie is a small amount of data, which often includes an anonymous unique identifier, sent to your browser from a websites computers and stored on your computers hard drive. We may use cookies to keep track of your choice of language and home page preference; to understand your exposure to certain Internet advertisements as you use the Websites, and to gather usage data that will help us generally improve the quality of the Websites. There is a simple procedure in most browsers that allows you to deny or accept cookies

We may place a cookie on your computer. A cookie is a small amount of data, which often includes an anonymous unique identifier, sent to your browser from a websites computers and stored on your computers hard drive. We may use cookies to keep track of your choice of language and home page preference; to understand your exposure to certain Internet advertisements as you use the Websites, and to gather usage data that will help us generally improve the quality of the Websites. There is a simple procedure in most browsers that allows you to deny or accept cookies

We also may use a small piece of code (sometimes referred to as 1x1 clear pixel, Web beacon or clear GIF) placed in the pages of the Websites to help us gather additional information about which parts of the site receive the most visitors and other user traffic patterns, and enable us to administer the site.

We also may use a small piece of code (sometimes referred to as 1x1 clear pixel, Web beacon or clear GIF) placed in the pages of the Websites to help us gather additional information about which parts of the site receive the most visitors and other user traffic patterns, and enable us to administer the site.
No Personally Identifiable Information (see below) is collected through our cookies or Web beacons
We only collect Personally Identifiable Information when you specifically provide it to us.

We may use Personally Identifiable Information to fulfill your requests, respond to your inquiries and provide other services, and to alert you to information, offers, or publications in which we think you may be interested. The emails that we send contain links that enable you to unsubscribe from such mailings.
